svg.script:
# Script: main """ Extension: pyscript v0.1 <by Frank D. Martinez> You can write valid python code here. Your code will be embedded into the document. Help: https://gitlab.com/mnesarco/inkscape-pyscript """
# ========= Import utility classes
from pyscript import svg
# ========= Define some basic line style
line_style = { 'fill' : 'none', 'stroke': '#000000', 'stroke-width' : '0.1', 'stroke-miterlimit' : '4', 'stroke-dasharray' : 'none' }
# ========= Create a simple Path (triangle)
path = svg.PathObject( style = line_style ) path.move( 100, 100 ) # Start at (100,100) path.line( 100, 0 ) # Horizontal Line of 100 path.line( 0, 100 ) # Vertical line of 100 path.close() # Close Path
# Put path in document # ink is a global reference to the inkscape extension (inkex) # ink.document.getroot() is the parent where we will put the triangle. can be any node # triangle1 is the id of the created path. (if already exists, will be overriden) path.create(ink, ink.document.getroot(), 'triangle1')
